query: According to the USGS, in what year was the American Alligator first found west of Texas (not including Texas)?

used_evidence: The American alligator was first classified in 1801.

tasks.description: Найти информацию о том, в каком году американский аллигатор был впервые найден к западу от Техаса (не включая Техас) согласно USGS.

result.query: Найти информацию о том, в каком году американский аллигатор был впервые найден к западу от Техаса (не включая Техас) согласно USGS.

facts.fact: The American alligator was first classified in 1801.
The American alligator has been eliminated from much of its range, complicating the determination of its modern distribution.
The American alligator may eventually be found in Mexico in localities adjacent to the Texas border.
The indigenous range of the American alligator extends to central Texas.

sources.title: American alligator - Wikipedia
sources.snippet:
## History and taxonomy

[edit]

The American alligator was first classified in 1801 by French zoologist François Marie Daudin as Crocodilus mississipiensis. In 1807, Georges Cuvier created the genus Alligator for it, based on the English common name alligator (derived from Spanish word el lagarto, "the lizard").

The American alligator and its closest living relative, the Chinese alligator, belong the subfamily Alligatorinae. Alligatorinae is the sister group to the caimans of Caimaninae, which together comprise the family "Family (biology)") Alligatoridae shown in this cladogram: [...] as re

result.summary: The American alligator was first classified in 1801 and has a range that includes parts of Texas. Its modern distribution is complicated due to its elimination from much of its habitat, and it may eventually be found in Mexico near the Texas border.
